channel.title: Editor: Amy C. Verdun on
channel.description: Recent content in Editor: Amy C. Verdun on

item.title: Addendum: Fifty Years of International Affairs Analysis: An Annotated Bibliography of Susan Strange's Academic Publications
item.description: May, Christopher. “Addendum: Fifty Years of International Affairs Analysis: An Annotated Bibliography of Susan Strange’s Academic Publications.” In Strange Power: Shaping the Parameters of International Relations and International Political Economy, edited by Thomas Lawton, James Rosenau, Amy C. Verdun, 421-443. London: Routledge, 2000. Keywords: Other Text access (external link)

item.title: Criticizing US Method and Thought in International Relations: Why a Trans-Atlantic Divide Narrows IR's Research Subject
item.description: Verbeek, Bertjan. “Criticizing US Method and Thought in International Relations: Why a Trans-Atlantic Divide Narrows IR’s Research Subject.” In Strange Power: Shaping the Parameters of International Relations and International Political Economy, edited by Thomas Lawton, James Rosenau, Amy C. Verdun, 139-158. London: Routledge, 2000. Keywords: Theory; United States; International Relations Text access (external link)

item.title: European Competitiveness and Enlargement: Is There Anyone in Charge?
item.description: Pellegrin, Julie. “European Competitiveness and Enlargement: Is There Anyone in Charge?.” In Strange Power: Shaping the Parameters of International Relations and International Political Economy, edited by Thomas Lawton, James Rosenau, Amy C. Verdun, 297-316. London: Routledge, 2000. Keywords: Economics; Authority; Markets; Political Economy; International Relations; Authority vs Markets Text access (external link)

item.title: Global Money and the Decline of State Power

Verdun, 115-135. London: Routledge, 2000. Keywords: Global governance; Globalization; Money and finance; Authority; Markets; States Text access (external link)

item.title: Going Beyond States and Markets to Civil Societies?

item.title: Ideology, Knowledge and Power in International Relations and International Political Economy
